results.description: Basic subject-verb agreement with plural noun

results.input: I has been working here since yesterday.
results.expected: I have been working here since yesterday.
results.actual: I have been working here since yesterday.

results.input: Yesterday, I go to the store.
results.expected: Yesterday, I went to the store.
results.actual: Yesterday, I went to the store.

results.input: I am study English for three years.
results.expected: I have been studying English for three years.
results.actual: I have been studying English for three years.

results.input: I went to store to buy apple.
results.expected: I went to the store to buy an apple.
results.actual: I went to the store to buy an apple.
results.description: Article usage with singular countable nouns

results.input: Despite of the rain, we continued playing.
results.expected: Despite the rain, we continued playing.
results.actual: Despite the rain, we continued playing.

results.input: He don't know nothing about it.
results.expected: He doesn't know anything about it.
results.actual: He doesn't know anything about it.

results.input: He made a decision to go.
The man which I saw yesterday is my teacher.
results.expected: The man whom I saw yesterday is my teacher.
results.actual: The man whom I saw yesterday is my teacher.

results.input: If I would have known, I would have came earlier.
results.expected: If I had known, I would have come earlier.
results.actual: If I had known, I would have come earlier.

results.input: i love pizza but i hate pasta
results.expected: I love pizza, but I hate pasta.
results.actual: I love pizza, but I hate pasta.

results.input: Being that it was late we left.
results.expected: Since it was late, we left.
results.actual: Since it was late, we left.

results.input: At this point in time we should proceed.
